column1: What do you call 1000 Jews on a train? It doesnt matter, theyre never coming back.
column3: Matter can refer to a subject of concern or importance (first meaning) and can also mean physical substance (second meaning).
column4: The scientist studied the matter to understand its properties.
column5: The matter at hand is quite serious and needs addressing.

column1: What do you call a puppy with a camera? A furtographer.
column3: Pup refers to a young dog (first meaning) and can also refer to a young offspring of certain animals (second meaning).
column4: The pup wagged its tail excitedly when it saw its owner.
column5: The teacher explained that a pup can also refer to a young wolf.

column1: Why do you never play hide & seek with mountains? Mountains peak.
column3: Peak means the top of a mountain (first meaning) and can also refer to reaching a maximum point of something (second meaning).
column4: The climbers reached the peak of the mountain after hours of hiking.
column5: The companys sales are expected to peak during the holiday season.

column1: Please note that only three jokes were applicable based on the requirements.
